definitions: the state of having a sufficient or considerable amount of natural light

examples.text: the glass adds lightness to the room
the lightness of the internal spaces

shortDefinitions: state of having considerable or sufficient amount of natural light

definitions: the quality of being pale in color

examples.text: the lightness of her silky hair

shortDefinitions: quality of being pale in colour

definitions: the quality of having little weight

examples.text: you can have the strength of steel with the lightness of aluminum

definitions: lack of density, thickness, or richness

examples.text: the lightness of the material makes them perfect for warm weather
I love the lightness of tempura batter

definitions: lack of pressure, force, or heaviness of movement

examples.text: the lightness of bow on strings

shortDefinitions: lack of pressure, force, or heaviness of movement

definitions: the quality of being gentle or delicate in style

examples.text: he lacked lightness of touch in his designs
the lightness of her approach remains unique

shortDefinitions: quality of being gentle or delicate in style

definitions: the quality of requiring little mental effort; lack of depth or seriousness

examples.text: the lightness of the dialogue made it frivolous

shortDefinitions: quality of requiring little mental effort

examples.text: a charm and lightness of heart
there was a lightness of mood on the streets

definitions: the quality of being easily borne or done

examples.text: none objected to the lightness of the sentence

shortDefinitions: quality of being easily borne or done
